com.nutiteq.components
Class Options

java.lang.Object
  com.nutiteq.components.Options

public class Options
extends java.lang.Object

Options for cache management, rendering and map manipulation.

Options

public Options(Components components)

Method Detail

isPreloading

public boolean isPreloading()
Checks the state of preloading.

Returns:
true if preloading is enabled

setPreloading

public void setPreloading(boolean preloading)
Sets the state of preloading, default is disabled. Preloading allows the downloading of tiles that are not currently visible on screen, but are adjacent to ones that are. This means that the user can pan the map without immediately noticing any missing tiles.

Enabling this option might introduce a small performance hit on slower devices. It should also be noted that this will considerably increase network traffic if used with online maps.

The exact area for which the tiles should be preloaded for can be defined using the setPreloadFOV method.

Parameters:
preloading - new preloading value

getPreloadFOV

public float getPreloadFOV()
Gets the current preloading field of view value in degrees.

Returns:
the current preloading field of view in degrees

setPreloadFOV

public void setPreloadFOV(float preloadFOV)
Sets the current preloading field of view in degrees. If preloading is enabled, this value will determine the size of the area for which the tiles should be downloaded. Minimum value is 120 degrees, maximum value is 160 degrees. It's worth noting that the camera's vertical field of view is 90 degrees.

Parameters:
preloadFOV - the new preload field of view in degrees

getSkyDrawMode

public int getSkyDrawMode()
Gets the current sky draw mode. Possible values: DRAW_NOTHING, DRAW_BITMAP.

Returns:
the current sky draw mode.

setSkyDrawMode

public void setSkyDrawMode(int skyDrawMode)
Sets a new background plane draw mode. Possible values:

DRAW_NOTHING - sky does't get drawn. Areas that are not covered by map tiles or background plane will be the colored by the color set by setClearColor.

DRAW_COLOR - this will default to DRAW_NOTHING. If solid color sky is desired, setClearColor should be used instead.

DRAW_BITMAP - draw the sky behind the map tiles and background plane. The bitmap provided will be wrapped around the world so that the first 25% are shown in the north, the next 25% in the east, the next 25% in the south and the last 25% in the west. The sky can be raised or lowered using the setSkyOffset method. The bitmap can be defined with setSkyBitmap. Enabling this might introduce a performance hit on slower devices.

Parameters:
skyDrawMode - the new background draw mode

setSkyBitmap

public void setSkyBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap skyBitmap)
Sets a new sky bitmap. See setSkyDrawMode for details. The width and height of the bitmap must be power of two (for example: 256 * 256 or 128 * 512). In the most common use case the width of the bitmap is 4 times the height (width == 4 * height), but this is not a requirement.

Parameters:
skyBitmap - the new sky bitmap

getSkyOffset

public float getSkyOffset()
Gets the current sky offset.

Returns:
the current sky offset

setSkyOffset

public void setSkyOffset(float skyOffset)
Sets a new sky offset value. This can be used for raising or lowering the sky, to match the desired part of the sky bitmap to the horizon. The default value is configured so that the lower part of the sky bitmap matches the horizon on the default draw distance. Positive values raise the sky, negative values lower it.

Parameters:
skyOffset - the new sky offset

getBackgroundPlaneDrawMode

public int getBackgroundPlaneDrawMode()
Gets the current background plane draw mode. Possible values: DRAW_NOTHING, DRAW_COLOR, DRAW_BITMAP.

Returns:
the current background plane draw mode.

setBackgroundPlaneDrawMode

public void setBackgroundPlaneDrawMode(int backgroundPlaneDrawMode)
Sets a new background plane draw mode. Possible values:

DRAW_NOTHING - background plane doesn't get drawn. Areas that are not covered by map tiles will be colored by the color set by setClearColor.

DRAW_COLOR - draws the background plane behind the map tiles. The color itself can be defined with setBackgroundPlaneColor. Background plane bitmap is ignored.

DRAW_BITMAP - draw the background plane behind the map tiles. The bitmap is repeated over the visible area and gets scaled with each zoom level. The bitmap can be defined with setBackgroundPlaneBitmap. Background plane color is ignored.

Parameters:
backgroundPlaneDrawMode - the new background plane draw mode

getBackgroundPlaneColor

public Color getBackgroundPlaneColor()
Gets the current background plane color.

Returns:
the current background plane color

setBackgroundPlaneColor

public void setBackgroundPlaneColor(int backgroundPlaneColor)
Sets a new background plane color. See setBackgroundPlaneDrawMode for details.

Parameters:
backgroundPlaneColor - the new background plane color

setBackgroundPlaneBitmap

public void setBackgroundPlaneBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap backgroundPlaneBitmap)
Sets a new background plane bitmap. See setBackgroundDrawMode for details. The width and height of the bitmap must be power of two (for example: 256 * 256 or 128 * 512). It's also preferred if the bitmap was square (width == height), but this is not a requirement.

Parameters:
backgroundPlaneBitmap - the new background plane bitmap.

getBackgroundImageDrawMode

public int getBackgroundImageDrawMode()
Gets the current background image draw mode. Possible values: DRAW_NOTHING, DRAW_BITMAP, DRAW_BACKDROP_BITMAP.

Returns:
the current background image draw mode.

setBackgroundImageDrawMode

public void setBackgroundImageDrawMode(int backgroundImageDrawMode)
Sets a new background image draw mode. Possible values:

DRAW_NOTHING - background image doesn't get drawn. Areas that are not covered by map tiles or the background plane will be colored by the color set by setClearColor.

DRAW_BITMAP - draw the background image behind the map tiles. The bitmap is drawn the same way as the first level of the map, regardless of the camera position. The bitmap can be defined with setBackgroundImageBitmap.

DRAW_BACKDROP_BITMAP - draw static background image facing the camera. The bitmap can be defined with setBackgroundImageBitmap.

Parameters:
backgroundImageDrawMode - the new background image draw mode

setBackgroundImageBitmap

public void setBackgroundImageBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap backgroundImageBitmap)
Sets a new background Image bitmap. See setBackgroundDrawMode for details. The width and height of the bitmap must be power of two (for example: 256 * 256 or 128 * 512). It's also preferred if the bitmap was square (width == height), but this is not a requirement.

Parameters:
backgroundImageBitmap - the new background Image bitmap.

getClearColor

public Color getClearColor()
Gets the current clear color.

Returns:
the current clear color

setClearColor

public void setClearColor(int clearColor)
Sets the clear color. Clear color is the first component that gets drawn. This color will visible in all empty areas of the screen. See setSkyDrawMode and setBackgroundPlaneDrawMode for details.

Parameters:
clearColor - the new clear color

getDrawDistance

public float getDrawDistance()
Gets the current draw distance

Returns:
the current draw distance

setDrawDistance

public void setDrawDistance(float drawDistance)
Sets a new draw distance. The higher the draw distance the more tiles can be seen, if the map is tilted. Changing the draw distance will cause the horizon to move, which means that the if the sky is set to DRAW_BITMAP, the horizon may not match up anymore. This can be corrected using setSkyOffset.

Increasing this value will decrease performance and increase network traffic, if online map is used.

Parameters:
drawDistance -

isTileFading

public boolean isTileFading()
Checks the state of tile fading.

Returns:
true if tile fading is enabled

setTileFading

public void setTileFading(boolean tileFading)
Sets the tile fade parameter, default is disabled. If enabled new tiles will fade in smoothly, instead of appearing out of thing air, at the cost of a performance hit. NOT IMPLEMENTED YET.

Parameters:
tileFading - the new state of tile fading

isSeamlessHorizontalPan

public boolean isSeamlessHorizontalPan()
Checks the state of seamless horizontal panning.

Returns:
true if seamless horizontal panning is enabled

setSeamlessHorizontalPan

public void setSeamlessHorizontalPan(boolean seemlessHorizontalPan)
Sets the state of seamless horizontal panning, default is disabled. If enabled, the user can scroll seamlessly from the left side of the map to the right, and the other way around..

Parameters:
seemlessHorizontalPan - the new state of seamless horizontal panning

isDoubleClickZoomIn

public boolean isDoubleClickZoomIn()
Checks the state of zooming in on double click.

Returns:
true if zooming in on double click is enabled

setDoubleClickZoomIn

public void setDoubleClickZoomIn(boolean doubleClickZoomIn)
Set the state of zooming in on double click.

Parameters:
doubleClickZoomIn - the new state of zooming in on double click

isDualClickZoomOut

public boolean isDualClickZoomOut()
Checks the state of zooming out on dual click.

Returns:
true if zooming out on dual click is enabled

setDualClickZoomOut

public void setDualClickZoomOut(boolean dualClickZoomOut)
Set the state of zooming out on dual click.

Parameters:
dualClickZoomOut - the new state of zooming out on dual click

isGeneralPanningMode

public boolean isGeneralPanningMode()
Checks the state of general panning mode.

Returns:
true if general panning mode is enabled

setGeneralPanningMode

public void setGeneralPanningMode(boolean generalPanningMode)
Set the state of general panning mode. In general panning mode, points under both fingers are moved to keep them in sync with finger movements. If this mode is switched off, map component tries to detect whether finger movement corresponds to rotation or scaling gesture. This provides smoother experience but less control.

Parameters:
generalPanningMode - the new state of general panning mode

isClickTypeDetection

public boolean isClickTypeDetection()
Checks the state of click type detection.

Returns:
true if click type detection is enabled. false otherwise.

setClickTypeDetection

public void setClickTypeDetection(boolean clickTypeDetection)
Set the state for click type detection. If enabled (enabled by default), clicks are categorized as normal clicks, double clicks, long clicks and dual clicks. This resolving take about 400ms, so for applications that do not require such resolving, it can be turned off.

Parameters:
clickTypeDetection - the new state for click type detection

isFPSIndicator

public boolean isFPSIndicator()
Checks the state of FPS indicator.

Returns:
true if FPS indicator is visible, false otherwise.

setFPSIndicator

public void setFPSIndicator(boolean fpsIndicator)
Enable/disable FPS indicator. FPS indicator displays current frame rate as overlay on top of the view. This provides rough estimate of the rendering performance and layer complexity. Note: in order this to be meaningful, continuous rendermode should be used!

Parameters:
fpsIndicator - true to display the indicator, false to hide.

getMapListener

public MapListener getMapListener()
Gets the map listener.

Returns:
the current map listener

setMapListener

public void setMapListener(MapListener mapListener)
Sets a new map listener.

Parameters:
mapListener - the new map listener

setTextureMemoryCacheSize

public void setTextureMemoryCacheSize(int textureMemoryCacheSize)
Sets a new size limit for the texture memory cache in bytes. Texture cache is the primary storage for raster data, all tiles contained within the texture cache are stored as uncompressed openGL textures and can immediately be drawn to the screen. If the texture cache is not big enough to store all the visible and preloaded tiles, artifacts start to show (such as disappearing tiles). The bigger the screen and the more raster layers there are, the bigger the texture cache should be. Example: typical hdpi device (480x800) has up to 4x5 256-pixel tiles visible, depending on zoom, rotation and tilting. For 20 tiles x 256x256 pixels x 16 bits/pixel = 20 MB is minimum. NB! Preloading = true setting doubles the requirement, and each raster overlay also requires extra 20MB. Larger screens (tablets) need also extra.

Parameters:
textureMemoryCacheSize - the new texture cache size in bytes

setCompressedMemoryCacheSize

public void setCompressedMemoryCacheSize(int compressedMemoryCacheSize)
Sets a new size limit for the compressed memory cache. Compressed cache is an optional secondary storage for raster data, all tiles contained within the compressed cache are stored as either JPGs or PNGs in the memory.

Parameters:
compressedMemoryCacheSize - the new compressed cache size

setPersistentCacheSize

public void setPersistentCacheSize(int persistentCacheSize)
Sets a new size limit for the persistent cache. Persistent cache is an optional tertiary storage for raster data, all tiles contained within the persistent cache are stored as either JPGs or PNGs in a database in the user specified directory.

Parameters:
persistentCacheSize - the new persistent cache size, in Bytes

setPersistentCachePath

public void setPersistentCachePath(java.lang.String persistentCachePath)
Sets a new database directory for the persistent cache. Persistent cache won't work until a path is specified.

Parameters:
persistentCachePath - the new persistent cache database path

isKineticPanning

public boolean isKineticPanning()
Checks the state of kinetic panning.

Returns:
true if kinetic panning is enabled

setKineticPanning

public void setKineticPanning(boolean kineticPanning)
Sets the state of kinetic panning. Default is disabled. Kinetic panning allows the map to move automatically using the inertia of the last swipe, after the user has finished interacting with the touch screen.

Parameters:
kineticPanning - new value of the kinetic panning flag.

isKineticRotation

public boolean isKineticRotation()
Checks the state of kinetic rotation.

Returns:
true if kinetic rotation is enabled

setKineticRotation

public void setKineticRotation(boolean kineticRotation)
Sets the state of kinetic rotation. Default is disabled. Kinetic rotation allows the map to rotate automatically using the inertia of the last rotation gesture.

Parameters:
kineticRotation - new state of the kinetic rotation flag

getTileSize

public int getTileSize()
Gets the current tile size in pixels, it will be used when drawing the tiles.

Returns:
current tile size. Default is 256.

setTileSize

public void setTileSize(int tileSize)
Sets the new tile size in pixels, it will be used when drawing the tiles.

Parameters:
tileSize - the new tile size in pixels

getTileZoomLevelBias

public float getTileZoomLevelBias()
Get the current zoom level bias for tiles.

Returns:
current tile zoom level bias. Default is 0.

setTileZoomLevelBias

public void setTileZoomLevelBias(float tileZoomLevelBias)
Set the current zoom level bias for tiles. Zoom level bias of 1 means that tiles with double resolution are used, -1 means that tiles with half resolution are used.

Parameters:
tileZoomLevelBias - the new zoom level bias for tiles

getRenderProjection

public int getRenderProjection()
Get render projection.

Returns:
either PLANAR_RENDERPROJECTION or SPHERICAL_RENDERPROJECTION

setRenderProjection

public void setRenderProjection(int renderProjection)
Set render projection. All view parameters are translated for new projection.

Parameters:
renderProjection - either PLANAR_RENDERPROJECTION or SPHERICAL_RENDERPROJECTION

getRasterTaskPoolSize

public int getRasterTaskPoolSize()
Get the number of threads currently used in the raster task pool.

Returns:
current raster task pool size.

setRasterTaskPoolSize

public void setRasterTaskPoolSize(int poolSize)
Set the number of threads used in the raster task pool. More threads means more tiles are downloaded in parallel. Default is one.

Parameters:
poolSize - new raster task pool size.
